parts.speaker: Hazel
parts.text: Hi dear.¬¬¬¬ I hope your day at work was good, was it too tiring? I-¬¬¬ My parents called earlier today.¬¬¬¬¬¬ They said the situation in Zuania is getting worse than they thought.¬¬¬¬ One of my father's former colleagues at the ministry got detained last week.

options.text: I might not be equipped to process that after the day I've had...

parts.speaker: Hazel
parts.text: Sorry for bringing it up so suddenly... I just¬¬ thought that with your new position you might be able to help them.¬¬¬¬ The media has a huge influence on people's views, so you can make such a positive impact by raising awareness about what Xaya is doing.

options.text: It's a really complicated situation. I'd be putting a lot at risk, not just for myself but also for my co-workers.
Something needs to be done. It's my responsibility now.

parts.speaker: Hazel
parts.text: I know I'm asking for a lot. You worked so much for this job, and I'm asking you to jeopardize it by speaking out.¬¬¬¬ But my family is your family too, and they need help. All of Zuania needs help.

parts.speaker: Hazel
parts.text: I know I can always trust you to do the right thing.¬¬¬ It's¬¬ terrifying¬¬ seeing every news outlet in the country carry water for Xaya, while they seek to erase our identity.

parts.speaker: Hazel
parts.text: The Xayan government is trying to erase our identity, assimilate my people into the misshapen, predatory being they have created, and you can change the outcome.

parts.speaker: Hazel
parts.text: As their monstrous amalgamation tries to swallow my culture, their tentacles wrap around the media and tighten every day with unvoiced threats of censorship and boycott.

parts.speaker: Hazel
parts.text: Sorry, I got carried away. What I'm asking from you is very hard.¬¬¬ I love you, and I know you will do what's best for us and for our family.¬¬¬ Let's talk about something fun now!
